front.title: Secure Password Ciphersuites for Transport Layer Security (TLS)

abstract.t: This memo defines several new ciphersuites for the Transport Layer Security (TLS) protocol to support certificate-less, secure authentication using only a simple, low-entropy, password. The exchange is called TLS-PWD. The ciphersuites are all based on an authentication and key exchange protocol, named "dragonfly", that is resistant to off-line dictionary attack.
